intro: Alstonia kurzii, commonly known as the Malayan alstonia, is a tropical tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its smooth, greyish bark and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, white flowers followed by woody capsules containing numerous seeds. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has been used in traditional medicine for its purported therapeutic properties. Alstonia kurzii thrives in humid, well-drained soils and is typically found in lowland rainforests.
